chapter.title: Ekiga: Using Voice over IP

abstract.para: Ekiga is an application you can use for making phone calls via Voice over IP (VoIP), for video conferencing and for instant messaging.

note.title: Ekiga May Not Be Installed
note.para: Before proceeding, make sure that the package ekiga is installed.

chapter.para: Before starting, make sure that the following requirements are met:

listitem.para: Your sound card is properly configured.
A headset or a microphone and speakers are connected to your computer.

For dialing in to regular phone networks, a SIP account is required. SIP (Signaling protocol for Internet Telephony) is the protocol used to establish sessions for audio and video conferencing or call forwarding.
For video conferencing: A Web cam is connected to your computer.

sect1.title: Starting Ekiga
sect1.para: To start Ekiga, open the Activities Overview by pressing and search for ekiga.

sect1.title: Configuring Ekiga
sect1.para: On first start, Ekiga opens a configuration assistant that requests all data needed to configure Ekiga. Proceed as follows:

step.para: Enter your full name (name and surname). Click Forward.
Enter your ekiga.net account data or choose not to register with . Click Forward.
Enter your Ekiga Call Out Account data or choose not to register with . Click Forward.
Set your connection type and speed. Click Forward.
Configure the audio devices to use by choosing the audio ringing, output and input device driver. In general, you can keep the Default setting. Click Forward.
Choose a video input device, if available. Click Forward.
Check the summary of your settings and apply them.
If registration fails after making changes to your configuration, restart Ekiga.

sect1.para: Ekiga allows you to maintain multiple accounts. To configure an additional account, proceed as follows:

step.para: Choose Accounts Add <account type>. If you are unsure, select Add a SIP Account.

Enter the Registrar to which you have registered. This is usually an IP address or a host name that will be given to you by your Internet Telephony Service Provider. Enter User, and Password according to the data provided by your provider.
Make sure Enable account is activated and leave the configuration dialog with OK. The account is displayed in the Ekiga main window, including its Status, which should change to Registered.

sect1.title: The Ekiga User Interface
sect1.para: The user interface has different modes. To switch between views, use the toolbar. The first mode is Contacts, the second is Dialpad and the last one is Call History. Click the camera icon to open the Call Window. It displays images from your local Web cam (or from a remote Web cam during a call).
By default, Ekiga opens in the Contacts mode. This view shows you a local address book which lets you quickly open connections to often-used numbers.
Many of the functions of Ekiga are available with key combinations. summarizes the most important ones.

entry.para: Initiate a call with the current number.
Add a contact to your address book.
Transfer the current call to another party.
Suspend the audio stream of the current call.
Suspend the video stream of the current call.
Activate Call Panel on the main user interface.
Zoom in to the picture from the Web cam.
Zoom out on the picture from the Web cam.
Return to the normal size of the Web cam display.
Use full screen for the Web cam.

sect1.title: Making a Call
sect1.para: After Ekiga is properly configured, making a call is easy.

step.para: Enter the SIP address of the party to call at the bottom of the window. The address should look like:

listitem.para: for direct local calls: sip:username@domainname or username@hostname

step.para: Click Call or press O and wait for the other party to pick up the phone.
To end the call, click Hang up or press .

sect1.para: If you need to tweak the sound parameters, click EditPreferences .

sect1.title: Answering a Call
sect1.para: Ekiga can receive calls in two different ways. First, it can be called directly with sip:user@host, or via SIP provider. Most SIP providers enable you to receive calls from a normal land-line to your VoIP account. Depending on the mode in which you use Ekiga, there are several ways in which you are alerted to an incoming call:

listitem.para: Incoming calls can only be received and answered if Ekiga is already started. You can hear the ring sound on your headset or your speakers. If Ekiga is not started, the call cannot be received.

Normally, the Ekiga panel applet runs silently without giving any notice of its existence. This changes when a call comes in. The main window of Ekiga opens and you hear a ringing sound on your headset or speakers.
listitem.remark: Is this really still true? I see absolutely no trace of a panel icon in GNOME Shell. (Haven't tried receiving a call, though.) However, when closing the window, Ekiga still seems to be running. - sknorr, 2015-09-23

sect1.para: Once you have noticed an incoming call, click Accept to answer the call then start talking. If you do not want to accept this call, click Reject. It is also possible to transfer the call to another SIP address.

sect1.title: Using the Address Book
sect1.para: Ekiga can manage your SIP contacts. All of the contacts are displayed in the Contacts tab, shown in the main window after start-up. To add a contact or a new contact group, select ChatAdd Contact.
If you want to add a new group, enter the group name into the bottom text box and click Add. The new group is then added to the group list and preselected.
The following entries are required for a valid contact:

listitem.para: Enter the name of your contact. This may be a full name, but you can also use a nickname here.
Enter a valid SIP address for your contact.
If you have many contacts, add your own groups.

sect1.para: To call a contact from the address book, double-click the contact. The call is initiated immediately.
